background: Platinum Database sells two types of subscription software packages, personal and commercial licenses, with associated costs and profits, and aims to maximize profits under certain constraints.
constraints: Number of personal licenses produced is non-negative
Number of commercial licenses produced is non-negative
Combined number of personal and commercial licenses produced cannot exceed MaxLicenses
Total cost to produce personal and commercial licenses cannot exceed TotalCostLimit
objective: Maximize the profit from the sale of personal and commercial software licenses
description: Platinum Database sells two types of subscription software packages: a personal license and a commercial license which will cost \param{PersonalLicenseCost} and \param{CommercialLicenseCost} to generate respectively. The marketing department estimates that they can sell at most \param{MaxLicenses} licenses for both versions combined a month. The profit per personal license is \param{PersonalLicenseProfit} and the profit per commercial version is \param{CommercialLicenseProfit}. If the company does not want to spend more than \param{TotalCostLimit}, how many of each software package should they produce to maximize the profits.

parameters.definition: Cost to generate a personal license
Cost to generate a commercial license
Maximum number of licenses sold per month
